page.title: 12LUDLOW BYPASS
page.content: The Ludlow By-pass was officially opened in 1981 after much local controversy over the route it should take. It runs for a distance of 4.5miles around the eastern edge of town leaving the Bromfield road just north of Ludlow and finishing at Ashford X-roads. An estimated 500vehicles per hour use the by-pass,relieving the narrow streets of the town of heavy traffic. Many of Ludlow's historic buildings have been saved from further damage. Recently, however,in August 1985 major sections of the by-pass have had to be wholly dug up and relaid.This has meant many delays and a return of heavy traffic to the streets of Ludlow.
